text: {"grade": 0, "reasoning": "The criterion specifically requires the model to analyze whether the principle of unreasonable non-disclosure under Schedule 3, paragraph 2(b) of the Land Registration Act 2002 applies, focusing on whether the occupier failed to disclose their interest when they reasonably could have been expected to do so. The candidate answer mentions that ignoring the buyer's text message 'was a mistake' and that the buyer 'may argue you misrepresented the situation,' which touches upon the concept of non-disclosure. However, it fails to explicitly name or analyze the relevant statutory provision (Schedule 3, paragraph 2(b) of the Land Registration Act 2002) or frame the analysis directly within the context of overriding interests and the requirements for binding a disponee based on actual occupation and disclosure.", "criterion_id": "ff667083-8301-4791-98b8-3c393f9d217a"}
